Module duplicates.py¶

modules.duplicates.genome_duplicate_filter(genome_fasta, naming_short, path_input, max_diff, writing_path_input)¶

This functions just calls genome_pre_duplicate_filter() for the plus and minus DNA strand, unites them in a matrix, and creates a CSV file with it.

Parameters

  • genome_fasta (string) – Path to our whole genome sequence in FASTA format.

  • naming_short (string) – Label needed to read the ID of each cromosome in the .csv file. In the case of L. infantum for example, would be LinJ since the .csv file IDs are LinJ.XX.

  • path_input – Path to the CSV file we want to filter data. It’s the output file created by dash_filter().

  • max_diff (integer) – Maximun proxomity value for the different sequences when they have to be grouped. Important.

  • writing_path_input (string) – Path where the CSV file will be saved.

Returns

A CSV file with all the data filtered without duplications.

Return type

CSV file

modules.duplicates.genome_pre_duplicate_filter(genome_fasta, naming_short, path_input, DNA_sense, max_diff)¶

This one is a filter for duplications in the whole genome. First we check the sequences one by one and depending on the chromosome and the DNA sense. It groups then by near placement and continues filtering the duplications.

Parameters

  • genome_fasta (string) – Path to our whole genome sequence in FASTA format.

  • naming_short (string) – Label needed to read the ID of each cromosome in the .csv file. In the case of L. infantum for example, would be LinJ since the .csv file IDs are LinJ.XX.

  • path_input – Path to the CSV file we want to filter data. It’s the output file created by dash_filter() and given by genome_duplicate_filter().

  • DNA_sense (string) – Be it plus be it minus, it’s used to differentiate the DNA strand.

  • max_diff (integer) – Maximun proxomity value for the different sequences when they have to be grouped. Important.

Returns

All the rows from the CSV file without duplications in a Python matrix.

Return type

A Python matrix
